tweets.html:
If movie violence leads to real life violence, then Fox News stupidity leads real life stupidity.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) January 7, 2013

New to Twitter? Find out what stupid things stupid people are saying a lot with the Trends link

— sweaty five dollars (@iscoff) January 7, 2013

*Checks calendar* How long 'til #TheWalkingDead comes back? *hates self*

— Julie Hammerle🔨 (@JulieHammerle) January 7, 2013

Between ABC's #Revenge and NBC's #Deception, it's only a matter of time before The CW greenlights a new show called #Betrayal.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) January 7, 2013

Dad: Brian why is there a show called Bunheads on the DVR Me: STOP JUDGING ME ITS ABOUT TEENAGE BALLERINAS AND ITS AWESOME

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) January 7, 2013

Hi, I'm Franklin Turner. This is my associate Bash Hooch.

— Joe Kwaczala (@joekjoek) January 7, 2013

In "Last Man Standing," every male character except Tim Allen's must be seated or lying down at all times.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) January 7, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Where are the ridiculous hashtags for #Bunheads? I sense an ABCFamily double-standard. #DubstepBoo

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) January 8, 2013

I seriously heart Victor Garber. No idea why, but there you go.

— Kathleen Battles (@katbat67) January 8, 2013

tweets.author_name: rich (who is, in many ways, poor)
tweets.html:
goodness. so, yeah. #BobsBurgers may be the best show currently airing.

— rich (who is, in many ways, poor) (@p00rrichard) January 8, 2013

It'd be awesome if you told someone you didn't like to go home and get their shinebox, and they had to do it.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) January 8, 2013

Also, I must say I'm very excited for the Super Bowl. I love football - look forward to it every year. #noagenda

— Neil Patrick Harris (@ActuallyNPH) January 8, 2013

you guys. life would just suck without TV. I mean what would we be doing? pushing that wood circle hula-hoop around with a stick?

— Alicia Gray (@AliGraysAnatomy) January 8, 2013

Spoiler Alert: On last night's DOWNTOWN ABBEY, there were no glasses laid for the pudding wine.

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) January 8, 2013

I want #sixseasonsandamovie of #BreakingAbbey. And #CougartonAbbey, come to think of it. #AllShowsShouldBeDowntonAbbey

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 8, 2013

If it turns out Matthew Crawley is in the same trench with Captain Blackadder, my head will explode. #Blackadder #DowntonAbbeyS2Catchup

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 8, 2013

Hey #DowntonPBS, thanks for the CANCER STORYLINE. I'm not looking for real life here. I just want to watch impossible humans in a time-zoo!

— Paul F. Tompkins (@PFTompkins) January 8, 2013

Breaking: Al Roker is a shitty weatherman.

— The Fake CNN (@TheFakeCNN) January 7, 2013

2013's Al Roker shitting his pants at the White House is 2014's Al Roker shitting his pants on the moon. #oleshitpants

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) January 8, 2013

Between Al Roker crapping his pants at the White House and Jeopardy featuring a contestant named Steve Money, this is a truly amazing night.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) January 8, 2013

I don't know what it is about Al Roker shitting his pants that you people find so funny.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) January 8, 2013

We just lost against the Wizards(.?!) If this is rock bottom, I don't know what is.

— Ashley Bright (@abrightgotcher) January 8, 2013

@CoryGBrown @JeffreyD405 I retract my last tweet! I was informed that Al Roker pooped his pants at the White House. That is rock bottom.

— Ashley Bright (@abrightgotcher) January 8, 2013

Al Roker did WHAT while about to do an interview in the White House?!?!?

— Bobby Rivers (@BobbyRiversTV) January 8, 2013

This Al Roker GIF forever http://t.co/vZ23INcE @tvobservatory @tvanddinners

— Mel (@melgotserved) January 8, 2013

Very few of you can speak about your sharting experiences with the dignity that Al Roker did.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) January 8, 2013

there's an improv team somewhere called "Al Roker Sharted" looking at each other right now like "no fucking way!"

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) January 8, 2013

Al Roker shit his pants when he visited the White House. Good night everyone.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) January 8, 2013

"College Football Player Can Play Scrabble" segment on ESPN right now. Seriously, this is where the bar is now?

— Caitlin Kelly (@caitlin__kelly) January 8, 2013

Must be so exciting for these kids to play in a BCS title game, wouldn't blame them for Rokering.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) January 8, 2013

If you're rooting for Bama it just shows that you can't accept Lady Sibyl and Branson's love.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) January 8, 2013

"Coach Saban, Al Roker sharted at the White House. Your thoughts?"

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) January 8, 2013

Wait, I thought @Pontifex joined Twitter to live tweet the Notre Dame game.

— andrew kaczynski🤔 (@KFILE) January 8, 2013

Literally just this second realized that "Roll Tide" is not some weird viral marketing campaign for Tide detergent.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) January 8, 2013

I'm not worried -this is the beginning of every Friday Night Lights state championship game. #katimsisonthis

— Zhibin Dai (@realzhibindai) January 8, 2013

Ew, Brent Musburger, stop salivating all over AJ McCarron's girlfriend. SHE COULD BE YOUR GRANDDAUGHTER - J

— Heather & Jessica (@fuggirls) January 8, 2013

By night's end, which will be greater: number of inappropriate Musburger comments about players' girlfriends or Notre Dame points?

— David Leonhardt (@DLeonhardt) January 8, 2013

According to twitter, if Musburger was any more infatuated w/McCarron's gf, by the end of the night I'd be hosting a show w/her on versus.

— Liam McHugh (@liam_mchugh) January 8, 2013

21-0. Sound of Nielsen meters humming softens. Clicking of remotes gets louder.

— Chris Ender (@soundbyte53) January 8, 2013

Start the counter now. As this #BCSNationalChampionship gets more out of hand ESPN is only going to show AJ Mccarrons girlfriend more & more

— Brian Janosch (@BJanosch) January 8, 2013

Halftime is just twenty minutes of Brent Musburger looking at Playboys and telling everyone who he likes.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) January 8, 2013

Oh poor sad ND fan about to GIF'd across the internet. You are my greatest fear

— NDPoot (@PootND) January 8, 2013

I haven't seen a group of Catholics this pathetic since the first hour of sister act

— Jeffrey Hadz (@Hadzilla) January 8, 2013

IMPORTANT: We've made a change to the drinking game. New rule: if you're a Notre Dame fan, DRINK.

— Adam Kramer (@KegsnEggs) January 8, 2013

It dawns on me that my opinion of Miami is based mainly on Will Smith videos and reruns of "Miami Vice."

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) January 8, 2013

I don't watch much football, but is this "Notre Dame" some sort of Make-a-Wish team?

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) January 8, 2013

What if they just started playing reruns of "Chopped" on the Jumbotron at the ND-Alabama game?

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) January 8, 2013

Karl Rove says Notre Dame still has a chance.

— andrew kaczynski🤔 (@KFILE) January 8, 2013

Don't tell me any of the great tweets about Notre Dame getting their ass kicked. I'm taping them. (For this joke I hooked my DVR up to iPad)

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) January 8, 2013

Miss O'Brien vs Thomas was more exciting than Notre Dame vs Alabama. #DowntonPBS #BCSChampionship

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) January 8, 2013

That was pretty rude of Barrett Jones to follow AJ's girlfriend on Twitter presnap.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) January 8, 2013

On the plus side, now Notre Dame doesn't have to visit the building where Al Roker pooped himself.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) January 8, 2013

Gun nut who was on CNN is so crazy that other gun nuts think he is a government plant to discredit all gun nuts. #sweetparanoia

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) January 8, 2013

"America was born on guns and whiskey." OMG! Someone please bury @realalexjones alive.

— Tara Banda 🐼 (@Tbanda) January 8, 2013

As he was leaving #PiersMorgan Alex Jones slipped in his own froth and broke his neck. #OrWasHePushedByTheGovernment

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) January 8, 2013

You couldn't pay me to watch Alex Jones talk to Piers Morgan

— slackbot (@pareene) January 8, 2013

It has been pointed out to me that it is actually my job to watch Alex Jones talk to Piers Morgan, I apologize for the error

— slackbot (@pareene) January 8, 2013

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
At this point in my life, I have more disdain for people who are pointedly Not Watching Bachelor than for those who enjoy it unironically.

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) January 8, 2013

That was weird, even for The Bachelor. #thebachelor #weird

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) January 8, 2013

Five minutes in, and the #Bachelor already reminds me of Patrick: bright pink face, always happy, blind faith in God. #Spongebob

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) January 8, 2013

"Tonight's the night I meet 25 women. There's SO many emotions going on inside of me!" Number one: BONER. #Bachelor

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) January 8, 2013

Wait a sec. Sean just walked off in the middle of meeting his ladies. Is he taking a dump or getting the poison out? #bachelor

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) January 8, 2013

If you don't think you can overstay your welcome in 27 seconds, you haven't met AshLee! #Bachelor

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) January 8, 2013

East coast viewers better have made a GIF of that hilarious back flip, or there is no point to this show existing. #Bachelor

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) January 8, 2013

BACHELOR SPOILER: Two women with the same first name will act like it's completely normal for adults to use the first letter of a last name.

— Vanessa Ramos (@thatRamosgirl) January 8, 2013

One of the things I learn most on the TV press tour is that I love British accents and would like one. Noted.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 8, 2013

What if Kourtney and Kim actually TOOK Miami? And refused to give it back.

— Jenni Konner (@JenniKonner) January 8, 2013

Saw Zero Dark Thirty! Great but a little anti Taliban but overall had it's good points. The ending was a little "Hollywood" for my tastes.

— Colin Quinn (@iamcolinquinn) January 8, 2013

DID YOU KNOW: Contestants on Wheel of Fortune sometimes fall onto the wheel and spin to death. They have to stop taping the show

— sweaty five dollars (@iscoff) January 8, 2013

Like you've never woken up at 6:30 a.m. to watch Bunheads.

— Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) January 8, 2013

Still running numbers, but very strong nominees. MT @ThisWasTV: This month's hall of fame is on best actors in a drama http://t.co/Mr5MDELc

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) January 8, 2013

That said, there are definitely suspicions that Ian McShane used steroids. And Jack Webb was a compiler.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) January 8, 2013

This year, the most depressing day of the year is equidistant between the last episode of Homeland and the first episode of Game of Thrones.

— Jon Purkis (@jonpurkis) January 8, 2013

Alternating between all the red wine and a jar of apple pie because #CougarTown and #Justified return tonight and I JUST LOVE YOU GUYS!

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) January 8, 2013
